conclusion: A hemispherical shell has inner and outer surface radii of R and √2R respectively.
A parallel beam of light with a cross-sectional radius of R is incident on the inner surface.
The direction of incidence is parallel to the axis of symmetry of the hemispherical shell.
All incident light rays can be transmitted from the outer surface of the hemispherical shell.
The refractive index of the transparent medium is known.
Determine the radius of the circular boundary on the outer surface where light rays are transmitted.
